name: UpdateRunnerGroupEnterprise
description:
Update the name and visibility of a self-hosted runner group in an enterprise.

Use this tool to update the name and visibility settings of a self-hosted runner group within a GitHub enterprise. This requires authentication with a token that has the 'manage_runners:enterprise' scope.

parameters.name: enterprise_identifier
parameters.description: The slug or ID of the enterprise to identify which enterprise the runner group belongs to.

value_schema.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.

parameters.name: runner_group_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the self-hosted runner group to update.

value_schema.description: Unique identifier of the self-hosted runner group.

parameters.name: runner_group_name
parameters.description: Name of the self-hosted runner group to be updated.

parameters.name: allowable_workflow_list
parameters.description: List of workflow names the runner group is allowed to run. Ignored unless `restricted_to_workflows` is set to `true`.

value_schema.description: List of workflows the runner group should be allowed to run. This setting will be ignored unless `restricted_to_workflows` is set to `true`.

parameters.name: runner_group_visibility
parameters.description: Specifies whether the runner group is visible to all organizations or only selected ones. Valid values are 'selected' or 'all'.

value_schema.description: Visibility of a runner group. You can select all organizations or select individual organizations.

parameters.name: allow_public_repositories
parameters.description: Set to true if the runner group can be used by public repositories.

value_schema.description: Whether the runner group can be used by `public` repositories.

parameters.name: restrict_to_workflows
parameters.description: Set to true to restrict the runner group to only the workflows in the selected_workflows array.

value_schema.description: If `true`, the runner group will be restricted to running only the workflows specified in the `selected_workflows` array.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: enterprise
parameters.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.

value_schema.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.

parameters.name: runner_group_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the self-hosted runner group.

value_schema.description: Unique identifier of the self-hosted runner group.

parameters.name: allows_public_repositories
parameters.description: Whether the runner group can be used by `public` repositories.

value_schema.description: Whether the runner group can be used by `public` repositories.

parameters.name: restricted_to_workflows
parameters.description: If `true`, the runner group will be restricted to running only the workflows specified in the `selected_workflows` array.

value_schema.description: If `true`, the runner group will be restricted to running only the workflows specified in the `selected_workflows` array.

parameters.name: selected_workflows
parameters.description: List of workflows the runner group should be allowed to run. This setting will be ignored unless `restricted_to_workflows` is set to `true`.

value_schema.description: List of workflows the runner group should be allowed to run. This setting will be ignored unless `restricted_to_workflows` is set to `true`.

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: Visibility of a runner group. You can select all organizations or select individual organizations.

value_schema.description: Visibility of a runner group. You can select all organizations or select individual organizations.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
